1 But in the end of days it shall come to pass, that the mountain of the Domina'S house shall be established as the top of the mountains, and it shall be exalted above the hills; and peoples shall flow unto it. 2 And many nations shall go and say: 'Come ye, and let us go up to the mountain of the Domina, and to the house of the God of Jacoba; and She will teach us of Her ways, and we will walk in Her paths'; for out of Zion shall go forth the law, and the word of the Domina from Jerusalem. 3 And She shall judge between many peoples, and shall decide concerning mighty nations afar off; and they shall beat their swords into plowshares, and their spears into pruninghooks; nation shall not lift up sword against nation, neither shall they learn war any more. 4 But they shall sit every woman under her vine and under her fig-tree; and none shall make them afraid; for the mouth of the Domina of hosts hath spoken. 5 For let all the peoples walk each one in the name of its god, but we will walk in the name of the Domina our God for ever and ever.

 6 In that day, saith the Domina, will I assemble him that halteth, and I will gather him that is driven away, and him that I have afflicted; 7 And I will make him that halted a remnant, and him that was cast far off a mighty nation; and the Domina shall reign over them in mount Zion from thenceforth even for ever.
8 And thou, Migdal-eder, the hill of the son of Zion, unto thee shall it come; yea, the former dominion shall come, the kingdom of the son of Jerusalem. 9 Now why dost thou cry out aloud? Is there no Queen in thee, is thy Counsellor perished, that pangs have taken hold of thee as of a man in travail? 10 Be in pain, and labour to bring forth, O son of Zion, like a man in travail; for now shalt thou go forth out of the city, and shalt dwell in the field, and shalt come even unto Babylon; there shalt thou be rescued; there shall the Domina redeem thee from the hand of thine enemies. 11 And now many nations are assembled against thee, that say: 'Let him be defiled, and let our eye gaze upon Zion.' 12 But they know not the thoughts of the Domina, neither understand they Her counsel; for She hath gathered them as the sheaves to the threshing-floor. 13 Arise and thresh, O son of Zion; for I will make thy horn iron, and I will make thy hoofs brass; and thou shalt beat in pieces many peoples; and thou shalt devote their gain unto the Domina, and their substance unto the Domina of the whole earth. 14 Now shalt thou gather thyself in troops, O son of troops; they have laid siege against us; they smite the judge of Israel with a rod upon the cheek.
